content: I saw a comment below saying that the most disabled people would disagree that the ADA should issue ID’s or permits — I understand what you mean, however as a disabled person myself, and moreso, as a person with spine damage that is also a “hidden disability” or “an invisible disability”, I would love something like a handicap card like drivers have that I could carry with me for when I travel, so that when I am on the subway, train, bus, or especially flying, I wouldn’t have to be so terrified of being challenged by people that I am “faking it” or worse simply have people not knowing that I’m disabled and having to prove it. It’s a constant fear and anxiety that I carry, and it is something that I’ve wished for since my accident years ago.
